testcase.name: test validate/2 - regex validates regex match
test validate/2 - exists_in fails when value not in list
test validate/2 - is_number fails on non-numeric string

test validate/2 - exists_in validates value is in list

test validate/2 - nullable fails when value is nil and nullable is false

test validate/2 - combined passes with multiple valid constraints
test validate/2 - is_number validates numeric string
test new/1 creates a new validator struct
test validate/2 - regex fails when no regex match
test hash_password/1 and password_matches?/2 hashes and verifies password
test request_next_discriminator/1 returns error if max discriminator reached
test is_registration_valid?/1 returns false if email is invalid
test get_user_by_email/1 returns error if not found

test user_exists?/1 returns true if user exists

test is_registration_valid?/1 returns true for valid data

test changeset casts only permitted fields
test changeset missing required fields is invalid
test changeset with valid data is valid
test delete_user/1 deletes the user

test get_user!/1 raises if user not found
test create_user/1 with invalid data returns error changeset
test create_user/1 with valid data creates a user

test get_user!/1 returns the user by email
test list_user/0 returns all users
test change_user/2 returns a valid changeset

test get_value/1 raises for {:error, _}
test err/1 defaults to {:error, nil} when no message is given
test get_error/1 raises for {:ok, _}
test is_err/1 returns false for a success result
test is_err/1 returns true for an error result
test get_value/1 returns the value for {:ok, value}
test err/1 wraps a message in {:error, message}
test from/1 wraps a value in {:ok, value}
test get_error/1 returns nil if no message was set
test POST /api/v1/register returns 400 for malformed JSON
test POST /api/v1/register returns 400 for missing fields
test POST /api/v1/register returns 401 on registration failure
test POST /api/v1/register returns 200 with valid registration
test token generation generates id token

test authorization code flow user_from_auth_code/2 returns {:ok, user} and marks code as used (PKCE S256)
